perturbation.original_text: 1.31 "SLA" means the Service Level Agreement attached hereto in Appendix 6.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.31 "SLA" means a general understanding of service expectations.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the definition of "SLA" from a specific, attached 'Service Level Agreement' in Appendix 6 to a vague 'general understanding,' the contract now refers to a formal agreement that effectively doesn't exist in a defined format. This creates an internal contradiction when other sections refer to the SLA and its specific terms.

perturbation.original_text: 1.15 "Hosting Service(s)" shall mean the network hosting (and related) services - as listed in Appendix 1 - provided by T-Mobile to ELEPHANT TALK under the Agreement, enabling ELEPHANT TALK to provide ELEPHANT TALK Wholesale Services to ELEPHANT TALK Customers in accordance with its terms and conditions of the Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.15 "Hosting Service(s)" shall mean the network hosting (and related) services provided by T-Mobile to ELEPHANT TALK under the Agreement, enabling ELEPHANT TALK to provide ELEPHANT TALK Wholesale Services to ELEPHANT TALK Customers in accordance with its terms and conditions of the Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrase 'as listed in Appendix 1,' this removes the clear definition of which hosting services are applicable. However, in section 3.1, it says 'T-Mobile shall provide the Hosting Services, as described in Appendix 1, during the term of this Agreement from the Ready for Service Date.' This is contradictory because Appendix 1 is now not explicitly tied to the definition, but is still used to describe the parameters of the Hosting Services.

perturbation.original_text: 3.6 Parties agree to implement the rules and procedures pursuant to Dutch legislation for number portability prior to the Ready for Service Date, according to Appendix 1. A ELEPHANT TALK MSISDN that is out-ported from ELEPHANT TALK's customer base will be barred from accessing the ELEPHANT TALK Services in the T-Mobile Network.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.6 Parties agree to implement the rules and procedures pursuant to Dutch legislation for number portability prior to the Ready for Service Date. A ELEPHANT TALK MSISDN that is out-ported from ELEPHANT TALK's customer base will be barred from accessing the ELEPHANT TALK Services in the T-Mobile Network.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrase 'according to Appendix 1,' this removes the clear reference to a description of Dutch legislation for number portability. However, section 2.9 states that Parties acknowledge that Dutch telecommunications market is regulated under both Dutch and EU law. This introduces ambiguity because the specific guidelines for number portability are missing.
